Many people will come from the east and from the west and will sit and eat with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
MT
8:12
But those people who should be in the kingdom will be thrown outside into the darkness, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.”
MT
8:13
Then Jesus said to the officer, “Go home. Your servant will be healed just as you believed he would.” And his servant was healed that same hour.
Week 18-31 | Two Blind Men's Faith
MT
9:27
When Jesus was leaving there, two blind men followed him. They cried out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
MT
9:28
After Jesus went inside, the blind men went with him. He asked the men, “Do you believe that I can make you see again?” They answered, “Yes, Lord.”
MT
9:29
Then Jesus touched their eyes and said, “Because you believe I can make you see again, it will happen.”
MT
9:30
Then the men were able to see. But Jesus warned them strongly, saying, “Don’t tell anyone about this.”
MT
9:31
But the blind men left and spread the news about Jesus all around that area.
Week 18-31 | A Dumb Demoniac
MT
9:32
When the two men were leaving, some people brought another man to Jesus. This man could not talk because he had a demon in him.
MT
9:33
After Jesus forced the demon to leave the man, he was able to speak. The crowd was amazed and said, “We have never seen anything like this in Israel.”
MT
9:34
But the Pharisees said, “The prince of demons is the one that gives him power to force demons out.”
Week 18-31 | Second Galilean Tour
LK
8:1
After this, while Jesus was traveling through some cities and small towns, he preached and told the Good News about God’s kingdom. The twelve apostles were with him,
LK
8:2
and also some women who had been healed of sicknesses and evil spirits: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
LK
8:3
Joanna, the wife of Cuza (the manager of Herod’s house); Susanna; and many others. These women used their own money to help Jesus and his apostles.
Week 18-31 | Raises The Son Of A Widow In Nain
LK
7:11
Soon afterwards Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his followers and a large crowd traveled with him.
LK
7:12
When he came near the town gate, he saw a funeral. A mother, who was a widow, had lost her only son. A large crowd from the town was with the mother while her son was being carried out.
LK
7:13
When the Lord saw her, he felt very sorry for her and said, “Don’t cry.”
LK
7:14
He went up and touched the coffin, and the people who were carrying it stopped. Jesus said, “Young man, I tell you, get up!”
LK
7:15
And the son sat up and began to talk. Then Jesus gave him back to his mother.
LK
7:16
All the people were amazed and began praising God, saying, “A great prophet has come to us! God has come to help his people.”
LK
7:17
This news about Jesus spread through all Judea and into all the places around there.
Week 18-31 | Questioning The Source Of Jesus' Power
LK
11:14
One time Jesus was sending out a demon who could not talk. When the demon came out, the man who had been unable to speak, then spoke. The people were amazed.
LK
11:15
But some of them said, “Jesus uses the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, to force demons out of people.”
LK
11:16
Other people, wanting to test Jesus, asked him to give them a sign from heaven.
LK
11:17
But knowing their thoughts, he said to them, “Every kingdom that is divided against itself will be destroyed. And a family that is divided against itself will not continue.
LK
11:18
So if Satan is divided against himself, his kingdom will not continue. You say that I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons.
LK
11:19
But if I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons, what power do your people use to force demons out? So they will be your judges.
LK
11:20
But if I use the power of God to force out demons, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
LK
11:21
“When a strong person with many weapons guards his own house, his possessions are safe.
LK
11:22
But when someone stronger comes and defeats him, the stronger one will take away the weapons the first man trusted and will give away the possessions.
LK
11:23
“Anyone who is not with me is against me, and anyone who does not work with me is working against me.
Week 18-31 | The Unpardonable Sin
MK
3:28
I tell you the truth, all sins that people do and all the things people say against God can be forgiven.
MK
3:29
But anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; he is guilty of a sin that continues forever.”
MK
3:30
Jesus said this because the teachers of the law said that he had an evil spirit inside him.
MT
12:34
You snakes! You are evil people, so how can you say anything good? The mouth speaks the things that are in the heart.
MT
12:35
Good people have good things in their hearts, and so they say good things. But evil people have evil in their hearts, so they say evil things.
MT
12:36
And I tell you that on the Judgment Day people will be responsible for every careless thing they have said.
MT
12:37
The words you have said will be used to judge you. Some of your words will prove you right, but some of your words will prove you guilty.”
Week 18-31 | Sign Of Jonah: Three Days And Three Nights
MT
12:38
Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law answered Jesus, saying, “Teacher, we want to see you work a miracle as a sign.”
MT
12:39
Jesus answered, “Evil and sinful people are the ones who want to see a miracle for a sign. But no sign will be given to them, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
MT
12:40
Jonah was in the stomach of the big fish for three days and three nights. In the same way, the Son of Man will be in the grave three days and three nights.
MT
12:41
On the Judgment Day the people from Nineveh(ap) will stand up with you people who live now, and they will show that you are guilty. When Jonah preached to them, they were sorry and changed their lives. And I tell you that someone greater than Jonah is here.
MT
12:42
On the Judgment Day, the Queen of the South(aq) will stand up with you people who live today. She will show that you are guilty, because she came from far away to listen to Solomon’s wise teaching. And I tell you that someone greater than Solomon is here.
Week 18-31 | Returning Evil Spirits
MT
12:43
“When an evil spirit comes out of a person, it travels through dry places, looking for a place to rest, but it doesn’t find it.
MT
12:44
So the spirit says, ‘I will go back to the house I left.’ When the spirit comes back, it finds the house still empty, swept clean, and made neat.
MT
12:45
Then the evil spirit goes out and brings seven other spirits even more evil than it is, and they go in and live there. So the person has even more trouble than before. It is the same way with the evil people who live today.”
Week 18-31 | Who Obeys God Are Truly Blessed
LK
11:27
As Jesus was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out to Jesus, “Blessed is the mother who gave birth to you and nursed you.”
LK
11:28
But Jesus said, “No, blessed are those who hear the teaching of God and obey it.”
Week 18-31 | Jesus' True Family
MT
12:46
While Jesus was talking to the people, his mother and brothers stood outside, trying to find a way to talk to him.
MT
12:47
Someone told Jesus, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside, and they want to talk to you.”(ar)
MT
12:48
He answered, “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”
MT
12:49
Then he pointed to his followers and said, “Here are my mother and my brothers.
MT
12:50
My true brother and sister and mother are those who do what my Father in heaven wants.”
Week 18-31 | The Sermon By The Sea In Galilee
Week 18-31 | The Sermon By The Sea (Gathering)
MT
13:1
That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the lake.
MT
13:2
Large crowds gathered around him, so he got into a boat and sat down, while the people stood on the shore.
Week 18-31 | A Story About Planting Seed
MK
4:2
Jesus taught them many things, using stories. He said,
MK
4:3
“Listen! A farmer went out to plant his seed.
MK
4:4
While he was planting, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and ate it up.
MK
4:5
Some seed fell on rocky ground where there wasn’t much dirt. That seed grew very fast, because the ground was not deep.
MK
4:6
But when the sun rose, the plants dried up because they did not have deep roots.
MK
4:7
Some other seed fell among thorny weeds, which grew and choked the good plants. So those plants did not produce a crop.
MK
4:8
Some other seed fell on good ground and began to grow. It got taller and produced a crop. Some plants made thirty times more, some made sixty times more, and some made a hundred times more.”
MK
4:9
Then Jesus said, “Let those with ears use them and listen!”
MK
4:10
Later, when Jesus was alone, the twelve apostles and others around him asked him about the stories.
MT
13:11
Jesus answered, “You have been chosen to know the secrets about the kingdom of heaven, but others cannot know these secrets.
MT
13:12
Those who have understanding will be given more, and they will have all they need. But those who do not have understanding, even what they have will be taken away from them.
MT
13:13
This is why I use stories to teach the people: They see, but they don’t really see. They hear, but they don’t really hear or understand.
MT
13:14
So they show that the things Isaiah said about them are true: ‘You will listen and listen, but you will not understand. You will look and look, but you will not learn.
MT
13:15
For the minds of these people have become stubborn. They do not hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might really understand what they see with their eyes and hear with their ears. They might really understand in their minds and come back to me and be healed.’ (Isaiah 6:9-10)
MT
13:16
But you are blessed, because you see with your eyes and hear with your ears.
MT
13:17
I tell you the truth, many prophets and good people wanted to see the things that you now see, but they did not see them. And they wanted to hear the things that you now hear, but they did not hear them.
MT
13:18
“So listen to the meaning of that story about the farmer.
LK
8:11
“This is what the story means: The seed is God’s message.
LK
8:12
The seed that fell beside the road is like the people who hear God’s teaching, but the devil comes and takes it away from them so they cannot believe it and be saved.
LK
8:13
The seed that fell on rock is like those who hear God’s teaching and accept it gladly, but they don’t allow the teaching to go deep into their lives. They believe for a while, but when trouble comes, they give up.
LK
8:14
The seed that fell among the thorny weeds is like those who hear God’s teaching, but they let the worries, riches, and pleasures of this life keep them from growing and producing good fruit.
LK
8:15
And the seed that fell on the good ground is like those who hear God’s teaching with good, honest hearts and obey it and patiently produce good fruit.
Week 18-31 | Be The Light For Others
MT
5:14
“You are the light that gives light to the world. A city that is built on a hill cannot be hidden.
MT
5:15
And people don’t hide a light under a bowl. They put it on a lampstand so the light shines for all the people in the house.
MT
5:16
In the same way, you should be a light for other people. Live so that they will see the good things you do and will praise your Father in heaven.
MK
4:22
Everything that is hidden will be made clear and every secret thing will be made known.
MK
4:23
Let those with ears use them and listen!
MK
4:24
“Think carefully about what you hear. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you, but God will give you even more.
LK
8:18
So be careful how you listen. Those who have understanding will be given more. But those who do not have understanding, even what they think they have will be taken away from them.”
Week 18-31 | By Itself The Earth Produces Grain
MK
4:26
Then Jesus said, “The kingdom of God is like someone who plants seed in the ground.
MK
4:27
Night and day, whether the person is asleep or awake, the seed still grows, but the person does not know how it grows.
MK
4:28
By itself the earth produces grain. First the plant grows, then the head, and then all the grain in the head.
MK
4:29
When the grain is ready, the farmer cuts it, because this is the harvest time.”
Week 18-31 | Wheat And Weeds
MT
13:24
Then Jesus told them another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who planted good seed in his field.
MT
13:25
That night, when everyone was asleep, his enemy came and planted weeds among the wheat and then left.
MT
13:26
Later, the wheat sprouted and the heads of grain grew, but the weeds also grew.
MT
13:27
Then the man’s servants came to him and said, ‘You planted good seed in your field. Where did the weeds come from?’
MT
13:28
The man answered, ‘An enemy planted weeds.’ The servants asked, ‘Do you want us to pull up the weeds?’
MT
13:29
The man answered, ‘No, because when you pull up the weeds, you might also pull up the wheat.
MT
13:30
Let the weeds and the wheat grow together until the harvest time. At harvest time I will tell the workers, “First gather the weeds and tie them together to be burned. Then gather the wheat and bring it to my barn.”’”
Week 18-31 | Mustard Seed
MT
13:31
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man planted in his field.
MT
13:32
That seed is the smallest of all seeds, but when it grows, it is one of the largest garden plants. It becomes big enough for the wild birds to come and build nests in its branches.”
Week 18-31 | Yeast
MT
13:33
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and hid in a large tub of flour until it made all the dough rise.”
Week 18-31 | Teaching By Stories
MK
4:33
Jesus used many stories like these to teach the crowd God’s message-as much as they could understand.
MK
4:34
He always used stories to teach them. But when he and his followers were alone, Jesus explained everything to them.
MT
13:35
This is as the prophet said: “I will speak using stories; I will tell things that have been secret since the world was made.” (Psalm 78:2)
Week 18-31 | The Treasure And The Pearl
MT
13:44
“The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure hidden in a field. One day a man found the treasure, and then he hid it in the field again. He was so happy that he went and sold everything he owned to buy that field.
MT
13:45
“Also, the kingdom of heaven is like a man looking for fine pearls.
MT
13:46
When he found a very valuable pearl, he went and sold everything he had and bought it.
Week 18-31 | Fishing Net
MT
13:47
“Also, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was put into the lake and caught many different kinds of fish.
MT
13:48
When it was full, the fishermen pulled the net to the shore. They sat down and put all the good fish in baskets and threw away the bad fish.
MT
13:49
It will be this way at the end of the age. The angels will come and separate the evil people from the good people.
MT
13:50
The angels will throw the evil people into the blazing furnace, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.”
Week 18-31 | Teacher Of Law Who Became Followers

MT
13:52

Week 18-31 | Jesus Finishes The Sermon By The Sea
MK
4:35
That evening, Jesus said to his followers, “Let’s go across the lake.”
Week 18-31 | Cost Of Following Jesus
MT
8:19
Then a teacher of the law came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, I will follow you any place you go.”
MT
8:20
Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes to live in, and the birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to rest his head.”
MT
8:21
Another man, one of Jesus’ followers, said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
LK
9:60
But Jesus said to him, “Let the people who are dead bury their own dead. You must go and tell about the kingdom of God.”
LK

Another man said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me go and say good-bye to my family.”
LK
9:62
Jesus said, “Anyone who begins to plow a field but keeps looking back is of no use in the kingdom of God.”

MK
4:36
Leaving the crowd behind, they took him in the boat just as he was. There were also other boats with them.
Week 18-31 | Wheat And Weeds Explanation
MT
13:36
Then Jesus left the crowd and went into the house. His followers came to him and said, “Explain to us the meaning of the story about the weeds in the field.”
MT
13:37
Jesus answered, “The man who planted the good seed in the field is the Son of Man.
MT
13:38
The field is the world, and the good seed are all of God’s children who belong to the kingdom. The weeds are those people who belong to the Evil One.
MT
13:39
And the enemy who planted the bad seed is the devil. The harvest time is the end of the age, and the workers who gather are God’s angels.
MT
13:40
“Just as the weeds are pulled up and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the age.
MT
13:41
The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will gather out of his kingdom all who cause sin and all who do evil.
MT
13:42
The angels will throw them into the blazing furnace, where the people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.
MT
13:43
Then the good people will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Let those with ears use them and listen.
Week 18-31 | The Galilean Ministry Goes On
Week 18-31 | Jesus Calms A Storm
LK
8:23
While they were sailing, Jesus fell asleep. A very strong wind blew up on the lake, causing the boat to fill with water, and they were in danger.
LK
8:24
The followers went to Jesus and woke him, saying, “Master! Master! We will drown!” Jesus got up and gave a command to the wind and the waves. They stopped, and it became calm.
LK
8:25
Jesus said to his followers, “Where is your faith?” The followers were afraid and amazed and said to each other, “Who is this that commands even the wind and the water, and they obey him?”
Week 18-31 | The Demoniacs Of Gadara
MK
5:1
Jesus and his followers went to the other side of the lake to the area of the Gerasene(k) people.
MK
5:2
When Jesus got out of the boat, instantly a man with an evil spirit came to him from the burial caves.
MK
5:3
This man lived in the caves, and no one could tie him up, not even with a chain.
MK
5:4
Many times people had used chains to tie the man’s hands and feet, but he always broke them off. No one was strong enough to control him.
MK
5:5
Day and night he would wander around the burial caves and on the hills, screaming and cutting himself with stones.
MK
5:6
While Jesus was still far away, the man saw him, ran to him, and fell down before him.
MK
5:7
The man shouted in a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I command you in God’s name not to torture me!”
MK
5:8
He said this because Jesus was saying to him, “You evil spirit, come out of the man.”
MK
5:9
Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “My name is Legion,(l) because we are many spirits.”
MK
5:10
He begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of that area.
MK
5:11
A large herd of pigs was feeding on a hill near there.
MK
5:12
The demons begged Jesus, “Send us into the pigs; let us go into them.”
MK
5:13
So Jesus allowed them to do this. The evil spirits left the man and went into the pigs. Then the herd of pigs-about two thousand of them-rushed down the hill into the lake and were drowned.
MK
5:14
The herdsmen ran away and went to the town and to the countryside, telling everyone about this. So people went out to see what had happened.
MK
5:15
They came to Jesus and saw the man who used to have the many evil spirits, sitting, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were frightened.
MK
5:16
The people who saw this told the others what had happened to the man who had the demons living in him, and they told about the pigs.
MK
5:17
Then the people began to beg Jesus to leave their area.
MK
5:18
As Jesus was getting back into the boat, the man who was freed from the demons begged to go with him.
MK
5:19
But Jesus would not let him. He said, “Go home to your family and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how he has had mercy on you.”
MK
5:20
So the man left and began to tell the people in the Ten Towns(m) about what Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.
Week 18-31 | Back To The Galilee Side Of The Lake
LK
8:40
When Jesus got back to Galilee, a crowd welcomed him, because everyone was waiting for him.
Week 18-31 | Raises Jairus' Daughter
MK
5:22
A leader of the synagogue, named Jairus, came there, saw Jesus, and fell at his feet.
MK
5:23
He begged Jesus, saying again and again, “My daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so she will be healed and will live.”
MK
5:24
So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed Jesus and pushed very close around him.
LK
8:43
A woman was in the crowd who had been bleeding for twelve years,(ab) but no one was able to heal her.
LK
8:44
She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his coat, and instantly her bleeding stopped.
LK
8:45
Then Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all the people said they had not touched him, Peter said, “Master, the people are all around you and are pushing against you.”
LK
8:46
But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, because I felt power go out from me.”
LK
8:47
When the woman saw she could not hide, she came forward, shaking, and fell down before Jesus. While all the people listened, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.
LK
8:48
Jesus said to her, “Dear woman, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace.”
LK
8:49
While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue leader and said to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”
LK
8:50
When Jesus heard this, he said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid. Just believe, and your daughter will be well.”
LK
8:51
When Jesus went to the house, he let only Peter, John, James, and the girl’s father and mother go inside with him.
LK
8:52
All the people were crying and feeling sad because the girl was dead, but Jesus said, “Stop crying. She is not dead, only asleep.”
LK
8:53
The people laughed at Jesus because they knew the girl was dead.
LK
8:54
But Jesus took hold of her hand and called to her, “My child, stand up!”
LK
8:55
Her spirit came back into her, and she stood up at once. Then Jesus ordered that she be given something to eat.
LK
8:56
The girl’s parents were amazed, but Jesus told them not to tell anyone what had happened.
Week 18-31 | John Asks For Affirmation From Jesus
MT
11:2
John the Baptist was in prison, but he heard about what the Christ was doing. So John sent some of his followers to Jesus.
MT
11:3
They asked him, “Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?”
MT
11:4
Jesus answered them, “Go tell John what you hear and see:
MT
11:5
The blind can see, the crippled can walk, and people with skin diseases are healed. The deaf can hear, the dead are raised to life, and the Good News is preached to the poor.
MT
11:6
Those who do not stumble in their faith because of me are blessed.”
Week 18-31 | Jesus' Testimony About John
LK
7:24
When John’s followers left, Jesus began talking to the people about John: “What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed(w) blown by the wind?
LK
7:25
What did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, people who have fine clothes and much wealth live in kings’ palaces.
LK
7:26
But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, and I tell you, John is more than a prophet.
LK
7:27
This was written about him: ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare the way for you.’ (Malachi 3:1)
LK
7:28
I tell you, John is greater than any other person ever born, but even the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than John.”
LK
16:16
“The law of Moses and the writings of the prophets were preached until John(bg) came. Since then the Good News about the kingdom of God is being told, and everyone tries to enter it by force.
LK
7:29
(When the people, including the tax collectors, heard this, they all agreed that God’s teaching was good, because they had been baptized by John.
LK
7:30
But the Pharisees and experts on the law refused to accept God’s plan for themselves; they did not let John baptize them.)
MT
11:14
And if you will believe what they said, you will believe that John is Elijah, whom they said would come.
MT
11:15
Let those with ears use them and listen!
LK
7:31
Then Jesus said, “What shall I say about the people of this time? What are they like?
LK
7:32
They are like children sitting in the marketplace, calling to one another and saying, ‘We played music for you, but you did not dance; we sang a sad song, but you did not cry.’
LK
7:33
John the Baptist came and did not eat bread or drink wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon in him.’
LK
7:34
The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him! He eats too much and drinks too much wine, and he is a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
LK
7:35
But wisdom is proved to be right by what it does.”
Week 18-31 | Jesus Warns Unbelievers
MT
11:20
Then Jesus criticized the cities where he did most of his miracles, because the people did not change their lives and stop sinning.
MT
11:21
He said, “How terrible for you, Korazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the same miracles I did in you had happened in Tyre and Sidon,(ak) those people would have changed their lives a long time ago. They would have worn rough cloth and put ashes on themselves to show they had changed.
MT
11:22
But I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
MT
11:23
And you, Capernaum,(al) will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to the depths. If the miracles I did in you had happened in Sodom,(am) its people would have stopped sinning, and it would still be a city today.
MT
11:24
But I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for Sodom than for you.”

LK

MK

MK

MK
6:3

MK
6:4

MK
6:5
So Jesus was not able to work any miracles there except to heal a few sick people by putting his hands on them.
MK
6:6
He was amazed at how many people had no faith. Then Jesus went to other villages in that area and taught.

MK

MT

MT

MT
15:28

Week 18-31 | A Deafmute Healed
MK
7:31
Then Jesus left the area around Tyre and went through Sidon to Lake Galilee, to the area of the Ten Towns.(y)
MK
7:32

MK
7:33
Jesus led the man away from the crowd, by himself. He put his fingers in the man’s ears and then spit and touched the man’s tongue.
MK
7:34

MK
7:35

MK
7:36
Jesus commanded the people not to tell anyone about what happened. But the more he commanded them, the more they told about it.
MK
7:37
They were completely amazed and said, “Jesus does everything well. He makes the deaf hear! And those who can’t talk he makes able to speak.”
MT
15:30

MT
15:31
The crowd was amazed when they saw that people who could not speak before were now able to speak. The crippled were made strong. The lame could walk, and the blind could see. And they praised the God of Israel for this.

MK
6:26

MK

MK
6:28
and brought it back on a platter. He gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

MT

MT

MT

14:27

Week 31 | Feast Of The Day Of Trumpets
JN
6:22
The next day the people who had stayed on the other side of the lake knew that Jesus had not gone in the boat with his followers but that they had left without him. And they knew that only one boat had been there.
JN

JN
6:25
When the people found Jesus on the other side of the lake, they asked him, “Teacher, when did you come here?”
JN
6:26
Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, you aren’t looking for me because you saw me do miracles. You are looking for me because you ate the bread and were satisfied.
JN
6:27
Don’t work for the food that spoils. Work for the food that stays good always and gives eternal life. The Son of Man will give you this food, because on him God the Father has put his power.”
JN
6:28
The people asked Jesus, “What are the things God wants us to do?”
JN
6:29

JN
6:30
So the people asked, “What miracle will you do? If we see a miracle, we will believe you. What will you do?
JN
6:31
Our ancestors ate the manna in the desert. This is written in the Scriptures: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”(y)
JN
6:32

JN

God’s bread is the One who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
JN
6:34
The people said, “Sir, give us this bread always.”
JN
6:35

JN
6:36
But as I told you before, you have seen me and still don’t believe.
JN
6:37
The Father gives me the people who are mine. Every one of them will come to me, and I will always accept them.
JN
6:38
I came down from heaven to do what God wants me to do, not what I want to do.
JN
6:39
Here is what the One who sent me wants me to do: I must not lose even one whom God gave me, but I must raise them all on the last day.
JN
6:40
Those who see the Son and believe in him have eternal life, and I will raise them on the last day. This is what my Father wants.”
JN
6:41
Some people began to complain about Jesus because he said, “I am the bread that comes down from heaven.”
JN
6:42
They said, “This is Jesus, the son of Joseph. We know his father and mother. How can he say, ‘I came down from heaven’?”
JN
6:43
But Jesus answered, “Stop complaining to each other.
JN
6:44
The Father is the One who sent me. No one can come to me unless the Father draws him to me, and I will raise that person up on the last day.
JN
6:45
It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’(z) Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from him comes to me.
JN
6:46
No one has seen the Father except the One who is from God; only he has seen the Father.
JN
6:47
I tell you the truth, whoever believes has eternal life.
JN
6:48
I am the bread that gives life.
JN
6:49
Your ancestors ate the manna in the desert, but still they died.
JN
6:50
Here is the bread that comes down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will never die.
JN
6:51
I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will live forever. This bread is my flesh, which I will give up so that the world may have life.”
JN
6:52
Then the evil people began to argue among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
JN
6:53
Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, you must eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood. Otherwise, you won’t have real life in you.
JN
6:54
Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood have eternal life, and I will raise them up on the last day.
JN
6:55
My flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
JN
6:56
Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood live in me, and I live in them.
JN
6:57
The living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father. So whoever eats me will live because of me.
JN
6:58
I am not like the bread your ancestors ate. They ate that bread and still died. I am the bread that came down from heaven, and whoever eats this bread will live forever.”
JN
6:59
Jesus said all these things while he was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
JN
6:60
When the followers of Jesus heard this, many of them said, “This teaching is hard. Who can accept it?”
JN
6:61
Knowing that his followers were complaining about this, Jesus said, “Does this teaching bother you?
JN
6:62
Then will it also bother you to see the Son of Man going back to the place where he came from?
JN
6:63
It is the Spirit that gives life. The flesh doesn’t give life. The words I told you are spirit, and they give life.
JN
6:64
But some of you don’t believe.” (Jesus knew from the beginning who did not believe and who would turn against him.)
JN
6:65
Jesus said, “That is the reason I said, ‘If the Father does not bring a person to me, that one cannot come.’”
JN
6:66
After Jesus said this, many of his followers left him and stopped following him.
JN
6:67
Jesus asked the twelve followers, “Do you want to leave, too?”
JN
6:68
Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, who would we go to? You have the words that give eternal life.
JN
6:69
We believe and know that you are the Holy One from God.”
JN
6:70
Then Jesus answered, “I chose all twelve of you, but one of you is a devil.”
JN
6:71
Jesus was talking about Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. Judas was one of the twelve, but later he was going to turn against Jesus.

John 6:4 misidentifies Trumpets as Passover. The Last Day and People's Resurrection are themes of Feast of Trumpets, not Passover

Week 31 | Hypocrite Hand Wash
MK
7:1
When some Pharisees and some teachers of the law came from Jerusalem, they gathered around Jesus.
MK
7:2
They saw that some of Jesus’ followers ate food with hands that were not clean, that is, they hadn’t washed them.
MK
7:3
(The Pharisees and all the Jews never eat before washing their hands in the way required by their unwritten laws.
MK
7:4
And when they buy something in the market, they never eat it until they wash themselves in a special way. They also follow many other unwritten laws, such as the washing of cups, pitchers, and pots.(s))
MK
7:5
The Pharisees and the teachers of the law said to Jesus, “Why don’t your followers obey the unwritten laws which have been handed down to us? Why do your followers eat their food with hands that are not clean?”
MT
15:3
Jesus answered, “And why do you refuse to obey God’s command so that you can follow your own teachings?
MT
15:4
God said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’(at) and ‘Anyone who says cruel things to his father or mother must be put to death.’(au)
MT
15:5
But you say a person can tell his father or mother, ‘I have something I could use to help you, but I have given it to God already.’
MT
15:6
You teach that person not to honor his father or his mother. You rejected what God said for the sake of your own rules.
MT
15:7
You are hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he said about you:
MT
15:8
‘These people show honor to me with words, but their hearts are far from me.
MT
15:9
Their worship of me is worthless. The things they teach are nothing but human rules.’” (Isaiah 29:13)
MK
7:15
There is nothing people put into their bodies that makes them unclean. People are made unclean by the things that come out of them. [
LK
11:40
You foolish people! The same one who made what is outside also made what is inside.
LK
11:41
So give what is in your dishes to the poor, and then you will be fully clean.
LK
11:42
How terrible for you Pharisees! You give God one-tenth of even your mint, your rue, and every other plant in your garden. But you fail to be fair to others and to love God. These are the things you should do while continuing to do those other things.
LK
11:43
How terrible for you Pharisees, because you love to have the most important seats in the synagogues, and you love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces.
LK
11:44
How terrible for you, because you are like hidden graves, which people walk on without knowing.”
LK
11:45
One of the experts on the law said to Jesus, “Teacher, when you say these things, you are insulting us, too.”
LK
11:46
Jesus answered, “How terrible for you, you experts on the law! You make strict rules that are very hard for people to obey, but you yourselves don’t even try to follow those rules.
LK
11:47
How terrible for you, because you build tombs for the prophets whom your ancestors killed!
LK
11:48
And now you show that you approve of what your ancestors did. They killed the prophets, and you build tombs for them!
LK
11:49
This is why in his wisdom God said, ‘I will send prophets and apostles to them. They will kill some, and they will treat others cruelly.’
LK
11:50
So you who live now will be punished for the deaths of all the prophets who were killed since the beginning of the world-
LK
11:51
from the killing of Abel to the killing of Zechariah,(ay) who died between the altar and the Temple. Yes, I tell you that you who are alive now will be punished for them all.
LK
11:52
“How terrible for you, you experts on the law. You have taken away the key to learning about God. You yourselves would not learn, and you stopped others from learning, too.”

Week 32 | Beware Of The Yeast Of The Pharisees
MT
16:1
The Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus, wanting to trick him. So they asked him to show them a miracle from God.
MT
16:2
Jesus answered,(aw) “At sunset you say we will have good weather, because the sky is red.
MT
16:3
And in the morning you say that it will be a rainy day, because the sky is dark and red. You see these signs in the sky and know what they mean. In the same way, you see the things that I am doing now, but you don’t know their meaning.
MK
8:12
Jesus sighed deeply and said, “Why do you people ask for a miracle as a sign? I tell you the truth, no sign will be given to you.”
MK
8:13
Then Jesus left the Pharisees and went in the boat to the other side of the lake.
MK
8:14
His followers had only one loaf of bread with them in the boat; they had forgotten to bring more.
MK

MK
8:16
His followers discussed the meaning of this, saying, “He said this because we have no bread.”
MK
8:17

MK
8:18

MK

MT
16:11

MT
16:12
Then the followers understood that Jesus was not telling them to beware of the yeast used in bread but to beware of the teaching of the Pharisees and the Sadducees.
Week 32 | Jesus Heals A Blind Man
MK
8:22

MK

MK

MK

Week 32-33 | Day Of Atonement In Caesarea Philippi

Jesus answered, “You are blessed, Simon son of Jonah, because no person taught you that. My Father in heaven showed you who I am.
MT
16:18
So I tell you, you are Peter.(ay) On this rock I will build my church, and the power of death will not be able to defeat it.
MT
16:19
I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; the things you don’t allow on earth will be the things that God does not allow, and the things you allow on earth will be the things that God allows.”
MT
16:20
Then Jesus warned his followers not to tell anyone he was the Christ.
MT
16:21
From that time on Jesus began telling his followers that he must go to Jerusalem, where the Jewish elders, the leading priests, and the teachers of the law would make him suffer many things. He told them he must be killed and then be raised from the dead on the third day.
MT
16:22
Peter took Jesus aside and told him not to talk like that. He said, “God save you from those things, Lord! Those things will never happen to you!”
MT
16:23
Then Jesus said to Peter, “Go away from me, Satan!(az) You are not helping me! You don’t care about the things of God, but only about the things people think are important.”
LK
9:23
Jesus said to all of them, “If people want to follow me, they must give up the things they want. They must be willing to give up their lives daily to follow me.
LK
9:24
Those who want to save their lives will give up true life. But those who give up their lives for me will have true life.
LK
9:25
It is worthless to have the whole world if they themselves are destroyed or lost.
MK
8:38
The people who live now are living in a sinful and evil time. If people are ashamed of me and my teaching, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes with his Father’s glory and with the holy angels.”

MT

I tell you the truth, some people standing here will see the Son of Man coming with his kingdom before they die.”
Week 33 | Day Of Atonement
MT

Six days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John, the brother of James, up on a high mountain by themselves.
LK

LK

LK

LK

LK

LK
9:34

LK

MT

MT

MT

MT

MT

Then the followers understood that Jesus was talking about John the Baptist.
Week 33 | Forcing Out A Difficult Evil Spirit
LK
9:37
The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met Jesus.
MK
9:16
Jesus asked, “What are you arguing about?”
MK
9:17

MK
9:18
When the spirit attacks him, it throws him on the ground. Then my son foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes very stiff. I asked your followers to force the evil spirit out, but they couldn’t.”
MK
9:19
Jesus answered, “You people have no faith. How long must I stay with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”
MK
9:20
So the followers brought him to Jesus. As soon as the evil spirit saw Jesus, it made the boy lose control of himself, and he fell down and rolled on the ground, foaming at the mouth.
MK
9:21
Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has this been happening?” The father answered, “Since he was very young.
MK
9:22
The spirit often throws him into a fire or into water to kill him. If you can do anything for him, please have pity on us and help us.”
MK
9:23
Jesus said to the father, “You said, ‘If you can!’ All things are possible for the one who believes.”
MK
9:24
Immediately the father cried out, “I do believe! Help me to believe more!”
MK
9:25
When Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he ordered the evil spirit, saying, “You spirit that makes people unable to hear or speak, I command you to come out of this boy and never enter him again!”
MK
9:26
The evil spirit screamed and caused the boy to fall on the ground again. Then the spirit came out. The boy looked as if he were dead, and many people said, “He is dead!”
MK
9:27
But Jesus took hold of the boy’s hand and helped him to stand up.
MK
9:28
When Jesus went into the house, his followers began asking him privately, “Why couldn’t we force that evil spirit out?”
MT
17:20
Jesus answered, “Because your faith is too small. I tell you the truth, if your faith is as big as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. All things will be possible for you. [
MT
17:21
That kind of spirit comes out only if you use prayer and fasting.]”(bc)

MT
17:26

Week 33 | Don't Cause Stumble
MT
18:6
If one of these little children believes in me, and someone causes that child to sin, it would be better for that person to have a large stone tied around the neck and be drowned in the sea.
MT
18:7
How terrible for the people of the world because of the things that cause them to sin. Such things will happen, but how terrible for the one who causes them to happen!
MT
18:8
If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to lose part of your body and live forever than to have two hands and two feet and be thrown into the fire that burns forever.
MT
18:9
If your eye causes you to sin, take it out and throw it away. It is better for you to have only one eye and live forever than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.
MK
9:49
Every person will be salted with fire.
Week 33 | Salt And Light
MT

“You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its salty taste, it cannot be made salty again. It is good for nothing, except to be thrown out and walked on.
Week 33 | The Lost Sheep
LK
15:1
The tax collectors and sinners all came to listen to Jesus.
LK
15:2

LK
15:3
Then Jesus told them this story:
LK
15:4
“Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep but loses one of them. Then he will leave the other ninety-nine sheep in the open field and go out and look for the lost sheep until he finds it.
LK
15:5
And when he finds it, he happily puts it on his shoulders
LK
15:6
and goes home. He calls to his friends and neighbors and says, ‘Be happy with me because I found my lost sheep.’
LK
15:7
In the same way, I tell you there is more joy in heaven over one sinner who changes his heart and life, than over ninety-nine good people who don’t need to change.
MT
18:14
In the same way, your Father in heaven does not want any of these little children to be lost.
Week 33 | The Lost Coin
LK
15:8

LK
15:9
And when she finds it, she will call her friends and neighbors and say, ‘Be happy with me because I have found the coin that I lost.’
LK
15:10
In the same way, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God when one sinner changes his heart and life.”
Week 33 | The Wasteful Son
LK
15:11
Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.
LK
15:12
The younger son said to his father, ‘Give me my share of the property.’ So the father divided the property between his two sons.
LK
15:13
Then the younger son gathered up all that was his and traveled far away to another country. There he wasted his money in foolish living.
LK
15:14
After he had spent everything, a time came when there was no food anywhere in the country, and the son was poor and hungry.
LK
15:15
So he got a job with one of the citizens there who sent the son into the fields to feed pigs.
LK
15:16
The son was so hungry that he wanted to eat the pods the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
LK
15:17
When he realized what he was doing, he thought, ‘All of my father’s servants have plenty of food. But I am here, almost dying with hunger.
LK
15:18
I will leave and return to my father and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against God and against you.
LK
15:19
I am no longer worthy to be called your son, but let me be like one of your servants.”’
LK
15:20
So the son left and went to his father. “While the son was still a long way off, his father saw him and felt sorry for his son. So the father ran to him and hugged and kissed him.
LK
15:21
The son said, ‘Father, I have sinned against God and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’(bf)
LK
15:22
But the father said to his servants, ‘Hurry! Bring the best clothes and put them on him. Also, put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
LK
15:23
And get our fat calf and kill it so we can have a feast and celebrate.
LK
15:24
My son was dead, but now he is alive again! He was lost, but now he is found!’ So they began to celebrate.
LK
15:25
“The older son was in the field, and as he came closer to the house, he heard the sound of music and dancing.
LK
15:26
So he called to one of the servants and asked what all this meant.
LK
15:27
The servant said, ‘Your brother has come back, and your father killed the fat calf, because your brother came home safely.’
LK
15:28
The older son was angry and would not go in to the feast. So his father went out and begged him to come in.
LK
15:29
But the older son said to his father, ‘I have served you like a slave for many years and have always obeyed your commands. But you never gave me even a young goat to have at a feast with my friends.
LK
15:30
But your other son, who wasted all your money on prostitutes, comes home, and you kill the fat calf for him!’
LK
15:31
The father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.
LK
15:32
We had to celebrate and be happy because your brother was dead, but now he is alive. He was lost, but now he is found.’”

Week 33 | An Unforgiving Servant
MT
18:23
“The kingdom of heaven is like a king who decided to collect the money his servants owed him.
MT
18:24
When the king began to collect his money, a servant who owed him several million dollars was brought to him.
MT
18:25
But the servant did not have enough money to pay his master, the king. So the master ordered that everything the servant owned should be sold, even the servant’s wife and children. Then the money would be used to pay the king what the servant owed.
MT
18:26
“But the servant fell on his knees and begged, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you everything I owe.’
MT
18:27
The master felt sorry for his servant and told him he did not have to pay it back. Then he let the servant go free.
MT
18:28
“Later, that same servant found another servant who owed him a few dollars. The servant grabbed him around the neck and said, ‘Pay me the money you owe me!’
MT
18:29
“The other servant fell on his knees and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you everything I owe.’
MT
18:30
“But the first servant refused to be patient. He threw the other servant into prison until he could pay everything he owed.
MT
18:31
When the other servants saw what had happened, they were very sorry. So they went and told their master all that had happened.
MT
18:32
“Then the master called his servant in and said, ‘You evil servant! Because you begged me to forget what you owed, I told you that you did not have to pay anything.
MT
18:33
You should have showed mercy to that other servant, just as I showed mercy to you.’
MT
18:34
The master was very angry and put the servant in prison to be punished until he could pay everything he owed.
MT
18:35
“This king did what my heavenly Father will do to you if you do not forgive your brother or sister from your heart.”

Week 34 | Teaching In The Temple At Feast Of Tabernacles
JN
7:14

JN
7:15
The people were amazed and said, “This man has never studied in school. How did he learn so much?”
JN
7:16

JN
7:17
If people choose to do what God wants, they will know that my teaching comes from God and not from me.
JN

Those who teach their own ideas are trying to get honor for themselves. But those who try to bring honor to the one who sent them speak the truth, and there is nothing false in them.
JN
7:19
Moses gave you the law,(ab) but none of you obeys that law. Why are you trying to kill me?”
JN
7:20

JN
7:21
Jesus said to them, “I did one miracle, and you are all amazed.
JN
7:22
Moses gave you the law about circumcision. (But really Moses did not give you circumcision; it came from our ancestors.) And yet you circumcise a baby boy on a Sabbath day.
JN
7:23
If a baby boy can be circumcised on a Sabbath day to obey the law of Moses, why are you angry at me for healing a person’s whole body on the Sabbath day?
JN
7:24
Stop judging by the way things look, but judge by what is really right.” Is Jesus the Christ?
JN
7:25
Then some of the people who lived in Jerusalem said, “This is the man they are trying to kill.
JN
7:26

JN
7:27
But we know where this man is from. Yet when the real Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”
JN

JN
7:29
But I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.”
JN

JN

JN
7:32
The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering these things about Jesus. So the leading priests and the Pharisees sent some Temple guards to arrest him.
JN
7:33

JN
7:34
You will look for me, but you will not find me. And you cannot come where I am.”
JN
7:35

JN
7:36
What did he mean when he said, ‘You will look for me, but you will not find me,’ and ‘You cannot come where I am’?”
Week 34 | Last Great Day Of Tabernacles
JN
7:37
On the last and most important day of the feast Jesus stood up and said in a loud voice, “Let anyone who is thirsty come to me and drink.
JN
7:38
If anyone believes in me, rivers of living water will flow out from that person’s heart, as the Scripture says.”
JN
7:39
Jesus was talking about the Holy Spirit. The Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus had not yet been raised to glory. But later, those who believed in Jesus would receive the Spirit.
JN
7:40
When the people heard Jesus’ words, some of them said, “This man really is the Prophet.”(ac)
JN
7:41

JN

JN

JN

JN
7:53
And everyone left and went home.
Week 34 | The Woman Caught In Adultery
JN
8:1
Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
JN
8:2
But early in the morning he went back to the Temple, and all the people came to him, and he sat and taught them.
JN
8:3
The teachers of the law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery. They forced her to stand before the people.
JN
8:4
They said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught having sexual relations with a man who is not her husband.
JN
8:5
The law of Moses commands that we stone to death every woman who does this. What do you say we should do?”
JN
8:6
They were asking this to trick Jesus so that they could have some charge against him. But Jesus bent over and started writing on the ground with his finger.
JN
8:7
When they continued to ask Jesus their question, he raised up and said, “Anyone here who has never sinned can throw the first stone at her.”
JN
8:8
Then Jesus bent over again and wrote on the ground.
JN

Those who heard Jesus began to leave one by one, first the older men and then the others. Jesus was left there alone with the woman standing before him.
JN
