Then Thomas (the one called Didymus) said to the other followers, “Let us also go so that we can die with him.”
JN
11:17
When Jesus arrived, he learned that Lazarus had already been dead and in the tomb for four days.
JN
11:18
Bethany was about two miles from Jerusalem.
JN
11:19
Many of the Jews had come there to comfort Martha and Mary about their brother.
JN
11:20
When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed home.
JN
11:21
Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
JN
11:22
But I know that even now God will give you anything you ask.”
JN
11:23
Jesus said, “Your brother will rise and live again.”
JN
11:24
Martha answered, “I know that he will rise and live again in the resurrection(ah) on the last day.”
JN
11:25
Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in me will have life even if they die.
JN
11:26
And everyone who lives and believes in me will never die. Martha, do you believe this?”
JN
11:27
Martha answered, “Yes, Lord. I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, the One coming to the world.”
JN
11:28
After Martha said this, she went back and talked to her sister Mary alone. Martha said, “The Teacher is here and he is asking for you.”
JN
11:29
When Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to Jesus.
JN
11:30
Jesus had not yet come into the town but was still at the place where Martha had met him.
JN
11:31
The Jews were with Mary in the house, comforting her. When they saw her stand and leave quickly, they followed her, thinking she was going to the tomb to cry there.
JN
11:32
But Mary went to the place where Jesus was. When she saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
JN
11:33
When Jesus saw Mary crying and the Jews who came with her also crying, he was upset and was deeply troubled.
JN
11:34
He asked, “Where did you bury him?” “Come and see, Lord,” they said.
JN
11:35
Jesus cried.
JN
11:36
So the Jews said, “See how much he loved him.”
JN
11:37
But some of them said, “If Jesus opened the eyes of the blind man, why couldn’t he keep Lazarus from dying?”
JN
11:38
Again feeling very upset, Jesus came to the tomb. It was a cave with a large stone covering the entrance.
JN
11:39
Jesus said, “Move the stone away.” Martha, the sister of the dead man, said, “But, Lord, it has been four days since he died. There will be a bad smell.”
JN
11:40
Then Jesus said to her, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believed you would see the glory of God?”
JN
11:41
So they moved the stone away from the entrance. Then Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank you that you heard me.
JN
11:42
I know that you always hear me, but I said these things because of the people here around me. I want them to believe that you sent me.”
JN
11:43
After Jesus said this, he cried out in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
JN
11:44
The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with pieces of cloth, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, “Take the cloth off of him and let him go.”
Week 43-62 | Priests Decide To Kill Jesus
JN
11:45
Many of the people, who had come to visit Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him.
JN
11:46
But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
JN
11:47
Then the leading priests and Pharisees called a meeting of the council. They asked, “What should we do? This man is doing many miracles.
JN
11:48
If we let him continue doing these things, everyone will believe in him. Then the Romans will come and take away our Temple and our nation.”
JN
11:49
One of the men there was Caiaphas, the high priest that year. He said, “You people know nothing!
JN
11:50
You don’t realize that it is better for one man to die for the people than for the whole nation to be destroyed.”
JN
11:51
Caiaphas did not think of this himself. As high priest that year, he was really prophesying that Jesus would die for their nation
JN
11:52
and for God’s scattered children to bring them all together and make them one.
JN
11:53
That day they started planning to kill Jesus.
JN
11:54
So Jesus no longer traveled openly among the people. He left there and went to a place near the desert, to a town called Ephraim and stayed there with his followers.
JN
11:55
It was almost time for the Passover Feast. Many from the country went up to Jerusalem before the Passover to do the special things to make themselves pure.
JN
11:56
The people looked for Jesus and stood in the Temple asking each other, “Is he coming to the Feast? What do you think?”
JN
11:57
But the leading priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where Jesus was, he must tell them. Then they could arrest him.
Week 43-62 | Jesus Talks About His Death In Details
LK
18:31
Then Jesus took the twelve apostles aside and said to them, “We are going to Jerusalem. Everything the prophets wrote about the Son of Man will happen.
LK
18:32
He will be turned over to those who are evil. They will laugh at him, insult him, spit on him,
LK
18:33
beat him with whips, and kill him. But on the third day, he will rise to life again.”
LK
18:34
The apostles did not understand this; the meaning was hidden from them, and they did not realize what was said.
Week 43-62 | The Ambition Of James And John
MK
10:35
Then James and John, sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we want to ask you to do something for us.”
MK
10:36
Jesus asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MK
10:37
They answered, “Let one of us sit at your right side and one of us sit at your left side in your glory in your kingdom.”
MK
10:38
Jesus said, “You don’t understand what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I must drink? And can you be baptized with the same kind of baptism that I must go through?”(am)
MK
10:39
They answered, “Yes, we can.” Jesus said to them, “You will drink the same cup that I will drink, and you will be baptized with the same baptism that I must go through.
MK
10:40
But I cannot choose who will sit at my right or my left; those places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
MK
10:41
When the other ten followers heard this, they began to be angry with James and John.
MK
10:42
Jesus called them together and said, “The other nations have rulers. You know that those rulers love to show their power over the people, and their important leaders love to use all their authority.
MK
10:43
But it should not be that way among you. Whoever wants to become great among you must serve the rest of you like a servant.
MK
10:44
Whoever wants to become the first among you must serve all of you like a slave.
MK
10:45
In the same way, the Son of Man did not come to be served. He came to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
Week 43-62 | Blind Men Of Jericho (Bartimaeus)
MK
10:46
Then they came to the town of Jericho. As Jesus was leaving there with his followers and a great many people, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus son of Timaeus was sitting by the road.
MT
20:30
Two blind men sitting by the road heard that Jesus was going by, so they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
MT
20:31
The people warned the blind men to be quiet, but they shouted even more, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
MT
20:32
Jesus stopped and said to the blind men, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MT
20:33
They answered, “Lord, we want to see.”
MT
20:34
Jesus felt sorry for the blind men and touched their eyes, and at once they could see. Then they followed Jesus.
Week 43-62 | Zacchaeus A Chief Tax Collector Changes His Heart
LK
19:2
A man was there named Zacchaeus, who was a very important tax collector, and he was wealthy.
LK
19:3
He wanted to see who Jesus was, but he was not able because he was too short to see above the crowd.
LK
19:4
He ran ahead to a place where Jesus would come, and he climbed a sycamore tree so he could see him.
LK
19:5
When Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down! I must stay at your house today.”
LK
19:6
Zacchaeus came down quickly and welcomed him gladly.
LK
19:7
All the people saw this and began to complain, “Jesus is staying with a sinner!”
LK
19:8
But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “I will give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have cheated anyone, I will pay back four times more.”
LK
19:9
Jesus said to him, “Salvation has come to this house today, because this man also belongs to the family of Abraham.
LK
19:10
The Son of Man came to find lost people and save them.”
Week 43-62 | Talents
LK
19:11
As the people were listening to this, Jesus told them a story because he was near Jerusalem and they thought God’s kingdom would appear immediately.
LK
19:12
He said: “A very important man went to a country far away to be made a king and then to return home.
LK
19:13
So he called ten of his servants and gave a coin(bo) to each servant. He said, ‘Do business with this money until I get back.’
LK
19:14
But the people in the kingdom hated the man. So they sent a group to follow him and say, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’
LK
19:15
“But the man became king. When he returned home, he said, ‘Call those servants who have my money so I can know how much they earned with it.’
LK
19:16
“The first servant came and said, ‘Sir, I earned ten coins with the one you gave me.’
LK
19:17
The king said to the servant, ‘Excellent! You are a good servant. Since I can trust you with small things, I will let you rule over ten of my cities.’
LK
19:18
“The second servant said, ‘Sir, I earned five coins with your one.’
LK
19:19
The king said to this servant, ‘You can rule over five cities.’
LK
19:20
“Then another servant came in and said to the king, ‘Sir, here is your coin which I wrapped in a piece of cloth and hid.
LK
19:21
I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You even take money that you didn’t earn and gather food that you didn’t plant.’
LK
19:22
Then the king said to the servant, ‘I will condemn you by your own words, you evil servant. You knew that I am a hard man, taking money that I didn’t earn and gathering food that I didn’t plant.
LK
19:23
Why then didn’t you put my money in the bank? Then when I came back, my money would have earned some interest.’
LK
19:24
“The king said to the men who were standing by, ‘Take the coin away from this servant and give it to the servant who earned ten coins.’
LK
19:25
They said, ‘But sir, that servant already has ten coins.’
LK
19:26
The king said, ‘Those who have will be given more, but those who do not have anything will have everything taken away from them.
LK
19:27
Now where are my enemies who didn’t want me to be king? Bring them here and kill them before me.’”
LK
19:28
After Jesus said this, he went on toward Jerusalem.
Week 62 | The Week Before The Second Passover In Jerusalem
Week 62 | Anointing By Mary
JN
12:1
Six days before the Passover Feast, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus lived. (Lazarus is the man Jesus raised from the dead.)
JN
12:2
There they had a dinner for Jesus. Martha served the food, and Lazarus was one of the people eating with Jesus.
JN
12:3
Mary brought in a pint of very expensive perfume made from pure nard. She poured the perfume on Jesus’ feet, and then she wiped his feet with her hair. And the sweet smell from the perfume filled the whole house.
JN
12:4
Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ followers who would later turn against him, was there. Judas said,
JN
12:5
“This perfume was worth an entire year’s wages. Why wasn’t it sold and the money given to the poor?”
JN
12:6
But Judas did not really care about the poor; he said this because he was a thief. He was the one who kept the money box, and he often stole from it.
JN
12:7
Jesus answered, “Leave her alone. It was right for her to save this perfume for today, the day for me to be prepared for burial.
JN
12:8
You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.”
JN
12:9
A large crowd of people heard that Jesus was in Bethany. So they went there to see not only Jesus but Lazarus, whom Jesus raised from the dead.
Week 62 | Priests Plan To Kill Jesus And Lazarus
JN
12:10
So the leading priests made plans to kill Lazarus, too.
JN
12:11
Because of Lazarus many of the Jews were leaving them and believing in Jesus.
LK
22:2
The leading priests and teachers of the law were trying to find a way to kill Jesus, because they were afraid of the people.
Week 62 | Judas Comes To An Agreement With The Priests
LK
22:3
Satan entered Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ twelve apostles.
LK
22:4
Judas went to the leading priests and some of the soldiers who guarded the Temple and talked to them about a way to hand Jesus over to them.
LK
22:5
They were pleased and agreed to give Judas money.
LK
22:6
He agreed and watched for the best time to hand Jesus over to them when he was away from the crowd.
Week 62 | In Jerusalem, People Greets Jesus As The King
MK
11:1
As Jesus and his followers were coming closer to Jerusalem, they came to the towns of Bethphage and Bethany near the Mount of Olives. From there Jesus sent two of his followers
MK
11:2
and said to them, “Go to the town you can see there. When you enter it, you will quickly find a colt tied, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here to me.
MK
11:3
If anyone asks you why you are doing this, tell him its Master needs the colt, and he will send it at once.”
MT
21:4
This was to bring about what the prophet had said:
MT
21:5
“Tell the people of Jerusalem, ‘Your king is coming to you. He is gentle and riding on a donkey, on the colt of a donkey.’” (Isaiah 62:11) (Zechariah 9:9)
MT
21:6
The followers went and did what Jesus told them to do.
MT
21:7
They brought the donkey and the colt to Jesus and laid their coats on them, and Jesus sat on them.
JN
12:17
There had been many people with Jesus when he raised Lazarus from the dead and told him to come out of the tomb. Now they were telling others about what Jesus did.
JN
12:18
Many people went out to meet Jesus, because they had heard about this miracle.
MK
11:8
Many people spread their coats on the road. Others cut branches in the fields and spread them on the road.
MK
11:9
The people were walking ahead of Jesus and behind him, shouting, “Praise God! God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord! (Psalm 118:26)
MK
11:10
God bless the kingdom of our father David! That kingdom is coming! Praise(an) to God in heaven!”
LK
19:39
Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell your followers not to say these things.”
LK
19:40
But Jesus answered, “I tell you, if my followers didn’t say these things, then the stones would cry out.”
JN
12:19
So the Pharisees said to each other, “You can see that nothing is going right for us. Look! The whole world is following him.”
LK
19:41
As Jesus came near Jerusalem, he saw the city and cried for it,
LK
19:42
saying, “I wish you knew today what would bring you peace. But now it is hidden from you.
LK
19:43
The time is coming when your enemies will build a wall around you and will hold you in on all sides.
LK
19:44
They will destroy you and all your people, and not one stone will be left on another. All this will happen because you did not recognize the time when God came to save you.”
MT
21:10
When Jesus entered Jerusalem, all the city was filled with excitement. The people asked, “Who is this man?”
MT
21:11
The crowd said, “This man is Jesus, the prophet from the town of Nazareth in Galilee.”
MK
11:11
Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the Temple. After he had looked at everything, since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the twelve apostles.
Week 62 | Jesus Curses A Fruitless Fig Tree
MK
11:12
The next day as Jesus was leaving Bethany, he became hungry.
MK
11:13
Seeing a fig tree in leaf from far away, he went to see if it had any figs on it. But he found no figs, only leaves, because it was not the right season for figs.
MK
11:14
So Jesus said to the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And Jesus’ followers heard him say this.
Week 62 | Second Cleansing Of The Temple
MK
11:15
When Jesus returned to Jerusalem, he went into the Temple and began to throw out those who were buying and selling there. He turned over the tables of those who were exchanging different kinds of money, and he upset the benches of those who were selling doves.
MK
11:16
Jesus refused to allow anyone to carry goods through the Temple courts.
MK
11:17
Then he taught the people, saying, “It is written in the Scriptures, ‘My Temple will be called a house for prayer for people from all nations.’(ao) But you are changing God’s house into a ‘hideout for robbers.’”(ap)
MT
21:14
The blind and crippled people came to Jesus in the Temple, and he healed them.
MT
21:15
The leading priests and the teachers of the law saw that Jesus was doing wonderful things and that the children were praising him in the Temple, saying, “Praise(bt) to the Son of David.” All these things made the priests and the teachers of the law very angry.
MT
21:16
They asked Jesus, “Do you hear the things these children are saying?” Jesus answered, “Yes. Haven’t you read in the Scriptures, ‘You have taught children and babies to sing praises’?”(bu)
MT
21:17
Then Jesus left and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.
Week 62 | The Fig Tree Has Dried Up By Next Morning
MK
11:20
The next morning as Jesus was passing by with his followers, they saw the fig tree dry and dead, even to the roots.
MK
11:21
Peter remembered the tree and said to Jesus, “Teacher, look! The fig tree you cursed is dry and dead!”
MK
11:22
Jesus answered, “Have faith in God.
MK
11:23
I tell you the truth, you can say to this mountain, ‘Go, fall into the sea.’ And if you have no doubts in your mind and believe that what you say will happen, God will do it for you.
MK
11:24
So I tell you to believe that you have received the things you ask for in prayer, and God will give them to you.
MK
11:25
When you are praying, if you are angry with someone, forgive him so that your Father in heaven will also forgive your sins. [
MK
11:26
But if you don’t forgive other people, then your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.]”(ar)
Week 62 | The Leaders Challenge Jesus' Authority
MK
11:27
Jesus and his followers went again to Jerusalem. As Jesus was walking in the Temple, the leading priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders came to him.
MK
11:28
They said to him, “What authority do you have to do these things? Who gave you this authority?”
MK
11:29
Jesus answered, “I will ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you what authority I have to do these things.
MK
11:30
Tell me: When John baptized people, was that authority from God or just from other people?”
MK
11:31
They argued about Jesus’ question, saying, “If we answer, ‘John’s baptism was from God,’ Jesus will say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
MK
11:32
But if we say, ‘It was from other people,’ the crowd will be against us.” (These leaders were afraid of the people, because all the people believed that John was a prophet.)
MK
11:33
So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said to them, “Then I won’t tell you what authority I have to do these things.”
Week 62 | The Two Sons Of The Vineyard Owner
MT
21:28
“Tell me what you think about this: A man had two sons. He went to the first son and said, ‘Son, go and work today in my vineyard.’
MT
21:29
The son answered, ‘I will not go.’ But later the son changed his mind and went.
MT
21:30
Then the father went to the other son and said, ‘Son, go and work today in my vineyard.’ The son answered, ‘Yes, sir, I will go and work,’ but he did not go.
MT
21:31
Which of the two sons obeyed his father?” The priests and leaders answered, “The first son.” Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, the tax collectors and the prostitutes will enter the kingdom of God before you do.
MT
21:32
John came to show you the right way to live. You did not believe him, but the tax collectors and prostitutes believed him. Even after seeing this, you still refused to change your ways and believe him.
Week 62 | The Evil Vineyard Farmers
MT
21:33
“Listen to this story: There was a man who owned a vineyard. He put a wall around it and dug a hole for a winepress and built a tower. Then he leased the land to some farmers and left for a trip.
MT
21:34
When it was time for the grapes to be picked, he sent his servants to the farmers to get his share of the grapes.
MT
21:35
But the farmers grabbed the servants, beat one, killed another, and then killed a third servant with stones.
MT
21:36
So the man sent some other servants to the farmers, even more than he sent the first time. But the farmers did the same thing to the servants that they had done before.
MT
21:37
So the man decided to send his son to the farmers. He said, ‘They will respect my son.’
MT
21:38
But when the farmers saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This son will inherit the vineyard. If we kill him, it will be ours!’
MT
21:39
Then the farmers grabbed the son, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
MT
21:40
So what will the owner of the vineyard do to these farmers when he comes?”
MT
21:41
The priests and leaders said, “He will surely kill those evil men. Then he will lease the vineyard to some other farmers who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time.”
MT
21:42
Jesus said to them, “Surely you have read this in the Scriptures: ‘The stone that the builders rejected became the cornerstone. The Lord did this, and it is wonderful to us.’ (Psalm 118:22-23)
MT
21:43
“So I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to people who do the things God wants in his kingdom.
MT
21:44
The person who falls on this stone will be broken, and on whomever that stone falls, that person will be crushed.”(bv)
MT
21:45
When the leading priests and the Pharisees heard these stories, they knew Jesus was talking about them.
MT
21:46
They wanted to arrest him, but they were afraid of the people, because the people believed that Jesus was a prophet.
Week 62 | The Wedding Feast Of The King's Son
MT
22:1
Jesus again used stories to teach them. He said,
MT
22:2
“The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding feast for his son.
MT
22:3
The king invited some people to the feast. When the feast was ready, the king sent his servants to tell the people, but they refused to come.
MT
22:4
“Then the king sent other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited that my feast is ready. I have killed my best bulls and calves for the dinner, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding feast.’
MT
22:5
“But the people refused to listen to the servants and left to do other things. One went to work in his field, and another went to his business.
MT
22:6
Some of the other people grabbed the servants, beat them, and killed them.
MT
22:7
The king was furious and sent his army to kill the murderers and burn their city.
MT
22:8
“After that, the king said to his servants, ‘The wedding feast is ready. I invited those people, but they were not worthy to come.
MT
22:9
So go to the street corners and invite everyone you find to come to my feast.’
MT
22:10
So the servants went into the streets and gathered all the people they could find, both good and bad. And the wedding hall was filled with guests.
MT
22:11
“When the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man who was not dressed for a wedding.
MT
22:12
The king said, ‘Friend, how were you allowed to come in here? You are not dressed for a wedding.’ But the man said nothing.
MT
22:13
So the king told some servants, ‘Tie this man’s hands and feet. Throw him out into the darkness, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.’
MT
22:14
“Yes, many are invited, but only a few are chosen.” Is It Right to Pay Taxes or Not?
Week 62 | Give To Caesar And To God As Belongs
MT
22:15
Then the Pharisees left that place and made plans to trap Jesus in saying something wrong.
MT
22:16
They sent some of their own followers and some people from the group called Herodians.(bw) They said, “Teacher, we know that you are an honest man and that you teach the truth about God’s way. You are not afraid of what other people think about you, because you pay no attention to who they are.
MT
22:17
So tell us what you think. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
MT
22:18
But knowing that these leaders were trying to trick him, Jesus said, “You hypocrites! Why are you trying to trap me?
MT
22:19
Show me a coin used for paying the tax.” So the men showed him a coin.(bx)
MT
22:20
Then Jesus asked, “Whose image and name are on the coin?”
MT
22:21
The men answered, “Caesar’s.” Then Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and give to God the things that are God’s.”
MT
22:22
When the men heard what Jesus said, they were amazed and left him and went away.
Week 62 | Sadducees About Resurrection
MT
22:23
That same day some Sadducees came to Jesus and asked him a question. (Sadducees believed that people would not rise from the dead.)
MT
22:24
They said, “Teacher, Moses said if a married man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and have children for him.
MT
22:25
Once there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died. Since he had no children, his brother married the widow.
MT
22:26
Then the second brother also died. The same thing happened to the third brother and all the other brothers.
MT
22:27
Finally, the woman died.
MT
22:28
Since all seven men had married her, when people rise from the dead, whose wife will she be?”
LK
20:34
Jesus said to them, “On earth, people marry and are given to someone to marry.
LK
20:35
But those who will be worthy to be raised from the dead and live again will not marry, nor will they be given to someone to marry.
LK
20:36
In that life they are like angels and cannot die. They are children of God, because they have been raised from the dead.
LK
20:37
Even Moses clearly showed that the dead are raised to life. When he wrote about the burning bush,(br) he said that the Lord is ‘the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’(bs)
LK
20:38
God is the God of the living, not the dead, because all people are alive to him.”
LK
20:39
Some of the teachers of the law said, “Teacher, your answer was good.”
LK
20:40
No one was brave enough to ask him another question. Is the Christ the Son of David?
Week 62 | The Most Important Command
MK
12:28
One of the teachers of the law came and heard Jesus arguing with the Sadducees. Seeing that Jesus gave good answers to their questions, he asked Jesus, “Which of the commands is most important?”
MK
12:29
Jesus answered, “The most important command is this: ‘Listen, people of Israel! The Lord our God is the only Lord.
MK
12:30
Love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, all your mind, and all your strength.’(av)
MK
12:31
The second command is this: ‘Love your neighbor as you love yourself.’(aw) There are no commands more important than these.”
MK
12:32
The man answered, “That was a good answer, Teacher. You were right when you said God is the only Lord and there is no other God besides him.
MK
12:33
One must love God with all his heart, all his mind, and all his strength. And one must love his neighbor as he loves himself. These commands are more important than all the animals and sacrifices we offer to God.”
MK
12:34
When Jesus saw that the man answered him wisely, Jesus said to him, “You are close to the kingdom of God.” And after that, no one was brave enough to ask Jesus any more questions.
Week 62 | How Can The Christ Be David's Son?
MT
22:41
While the Pharisees were together, Jesus asked them,
MT
22:42
“What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They answered, “The Christ is the Son of David.”
MT
22:43
Then Jesus said to them, “Then why did David call him ‘Lord’? David, speaking by the power of the Holy Spirit, said,
MT
22:44
‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by me at my right side, until I put your enemies under your control.”’ (Psalm 110:1)
MT
22:45
David calls the Christ ‘Lord,’ so how can the Christ be his son?”
MT
22:46
None of the Pharisees could answer Jesus’ question, and after that day no one was brave enough to ask him any more questions.
Week 62 | How Terrible For You Teachers Of The Law And Pharisees
MT
23:1
Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his followers,
MT
23:2
“The teachers of the law and the Pharisees have the authority to tell you what the law of Moses says.
MT
23:3
So you should obey and follow whatever they tell you, but their lives are not good examples for you to follow. They tell you to do things, but they themselves don’t do them.
MT
23:4
They make strict rules and try to force people to obey them, but they are unwilling to help those who struggle under the weight of their rules.
MT
23:5
“They do good things so that other people will see them. They enlarge the little boxes(cb) holding Scriptures that they wear, and they make their special prayer clothes very long.
MT
23:6
Those Pharisees and teachers of the law love to have the most important seats at feasts and in the synagogues.
MT
23:7
They love people to greet them with respect in the marketplaces, and they love to have people call them ‘Teacher.’
MT
23:8
“But you must not be called ‘Teacher,’ because you have only one Teacher, and you are all brothers and sisters together.
MT
23:9
And don’t call any person on earth ‘Father,’ because you have one Father, who is in heaven.
MT
23:10
And you should not be called ‘Master,’ because you have only one Master, the Christ.
MT
23:11
Whoever is your servant is the greatest among you.
MT
23:12
Whoever makes himself great will be made humble. Whoever makes himself humble will be made great.
MT
23:13
“How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees! You are hypocrites! You close the door for people to enter the kingdom of heaven. You yourselves don’t enter, and you stop others who are trying to enter. [
MT
23:14
How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees. You are hypocrites. You take away widows’ houses, and you say long prayers so that people will notice you. So you will have a worse punishment.](cc)
MT
23:15
“How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees! You are hypocrites! You travel across land and sea to find one person who will change to your ways. When you find that person, you make him more fit for hell than you are.
MT
23:16
“How terrible for you! You guide the people, but you are blind. You say, ‘If people swear by the Temple when they make a promise, that means nothing. But if they swear by the gold that is in the Temple, they must keep that promise.’
MT
23:17
You are blind fools! Which is greater: the gold or the Temple that makes that gold holy?
MT
23:18
And you say, ‘If people swear by the altar when they make a promise, that means nothing. But if they swear by the gift on the altar, they must keep that promise.’
MT
23:19
You are blind! Which is greater: the gift or the altar that makes the gift holy?
MT
23:20
The person who swears by the altar is really using the altar and also everything on the altar.
MT
23:21
And the person who swears by the Temple is really using the Temple and also everything in the Temple.
MT
23:22
The person who swears by heaven is also using God’s throne and the One who sits on that throne.
MT
23:23
“How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees! You are hypocrites! You give to God one-tenth of everything you earn-even your mint, dill, and cumin.(cd) But you don’t obey the really important teachings of the law-justice, mercy, and being loyal. These are the things you should do, as well as those other things.
MT
23:24
You guide the people, but you are blind! You are like a person who picks a fly out of a drink and then swallows a camel!(ce)
MT
23:25
“How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees! You are hypocrites! You wash the outside of your cups and dishes, but inside they are full of things you got by cheating others and by pleasing only yourselves.
MT
23:26
Pharisees, you are blind! First make the inside of the cup clean, and then the outside of the cup can be truly clean.
MT
23:27
“How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees! You are hypocrites! You are like tombs that are painted white. Outside, those tombs look fine, but inside, they are full of the bones of dead people and all kinds of unclean things.
MT
23:28
It is the same with you. People look at you and think you are good, but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and evil.
MT
23:29
“How terrible for you, teachers of the law and Pharisees! You are hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets, and you show honor to the graves of those who lived good lives.
MT
23:30
You say, ‘If we had lived during the time of our ancestors, we would not have helped them kill the prophets.’
MT
23:31
But you give proof that you are descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
MT
23:32
And you will complete the sin that your ancestors started.
MT
23:33
“You are snakes! A family of poisonous snakes! How are you going to escape God’s judgment?
MT
23:34
So I tell you this: I am sending to you prophets and wise men and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify. Some of them you will beat in your synagogues and chase from town to town.
MT
23:35
So you will be guilty for the death of all the good people who have been killed on earth-from the murder of that good man Abel to the murder of Zechariah(cf) son of Berakiah, whom you murdered between the Temple and the altar.
MT
23:36
I tell you the truth, all of these things will happen to you people who are living now.
Week 62 | The Widow's Cents
MK
12:41
Jesus sat near the Temple money box and watched the people put in their money. Many rich people gave large sums of money.
MK
12:42
Then a poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which were only worth a few cents.
MK
12:43
Calling his followers to him, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow gave more than all those rich people.
MK
12:44
They gave only what they did not need. This woman is very poor, but she gave all she had; she gave all she had to live on.”
Week 62 | Visitors From The West At The End Of Jesus' Life
JN
12:20
There were some Greek people, too, who came to Jerusalem to worship at the Passover Feast.
JN

JN

Philip told Andrew, and then Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
JN

Jesus said to them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to receive his glory.
JN

JN
12:25
Those who love their lives will lose them, but those who hate their lives in this world will keep true life forever.
JN
12:26
Whoever serves me must follow me. Then my servant will be with me everywhere I am. My Father will honor anyone who serves me.
JN
12:27
“Now I am very troubled. Should I say, ‘Father, save me from this time’? No, I came to this time so I could suffer.
JN
12:28
Father, bring glory to your name!” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have brought glory to it, and I will do it again.”
JN
12:29
The crowd standing there, who heard the voice, said it was thunder. But others said, “An angel has spoken to him.”
JN
12:30
Jesus said, “That voice was for your sake, not mine.
JN
12:31
Now is the time for the world to be judged; now the ruler of this world will be thrown down.
JN

If I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw all people toward me.”
JN
12:33
Jesus said this to show how he would die.
JN
12:34
The crowd said, “We have heard from the law that the Christ will live forever. So why do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this ‘Son of Man’?”
JN
12:35

JN
12:36
Believe in the light while you still have it so that you will become children of light.” When Jesus had said this, he left and hid himself from them.
Week 62 | Whoever Believes In Jesus Believes In The One
JN
12:37
Though Jesus had done many miracles in front of the people, they still did not believe in him.
JN
12:38
This was to bring about what Isaiah the prophet had said: “Lord, who believed what we told them? Who saw the Lord’s power in this?” (Isaiah 53:1)
JN
12:39
This is why the people could not believe: Isaiah also had said,
JN
12:40
“He has blinded their eyes, and he has closed their minds. Otherwise they would see with their eyes and understand in their minds and come back to me and be healed.” (Isaiah 6:10)
JN
12:41
Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus’ glory and spoke about him.
JN
12:42
But many believed in Jesus, even many of the leaders. But because of the Pharisees, they did not say they believed in him for fear they would be put out of the synagogue.
JN
12:43
They loved praise from people more than praise from God.
JN
12:44
Then Jesus cried out, “Whoever believes in me is really believing in the One who sent me.
JN
12:45
Whoever sees me sees the One who sent me.
JN
12:46
I have come as light into the world so that whoever believes in me would not stay in darkness.
JN
12:47
“Anyone who hears my words and does not obey them, I do not judge, because I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
JN
12:48
There is a judge for those who refuse to believe in me and do not accept my words. The word I have taught will be their judge on the last day.
JN
12:49
The things I taught were not from myself. The Father who sent me told me what to say and what to teach.
JN
12:50
And I know that eternal life comes from what the Father commands. So whatever I say is what the Father told me to say.”

LK
12:48

Week 63 | The Leader Should Be Like The Servant
LK
22:24

22:26

LK

Week 63 | Jesus Washes His Followers’ Feet
JN
13:1
It was almost time for the Passover Feast. Jesus knew that it was time for him to leave this world and go back to the Father. He had always loved those who were his own in the world, and he loved them all the way to the end.
JN
13:2
Jesus and his followers were at the evening meal. The devil had already persuaded Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, to turn against Jesus.
JN
13:3
Jesus knew that the Father had given him power over everything and that he had come from God and was going back to God.
JN
13:4
So during the meal Jesus stood up and took off his outer clothing. Taking a towel, he wrapped it around his waist.
JN
13:5
Then he poured water into a bowl and began to wash the followers’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.
JN
13:6
Jesus came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
JN
13:7
Jesus answered, “You don’t understand now what I am doing, but you will understand later.”
JN
13:8
Peter said, “No, you will never wash my feet.” Jesus answered, “If I don’t wash your feet, you are not one of my people.”
JN
13:9
Simon Peter answered, “Lord, then wash not only my feet, but wash my hands and my head, too!”
JN
13:10
Jesus said, “After a person has had a bath, his whole body is clean. He needs only to wash his feet. And you men are clean, but not all of you.”
JN
13:11
Jesus knew who would turn against him, and that is why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
JN
13:12
When he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and sat down again. He asked, “Do you understand what I have just done for you?
JN
13:13
You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and you are right, because that is what I am.
JN
13:14
If I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash each other’s feet.
JN
13:15
I did this as an example so that you should do as I have done for you.
Week 63 | A Servant Is Not Greater Than His Master
JN
13:16
I tell you the truth, a servant is not greater than his master. A messenger is not greater than the one who sent him.
JN
13:17
If you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
Week 63 | Whoever Accepts Jesus, Accepts The One
LK

“Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever refuses to accept you refuses to accept me. And whoever refuses to accept me refuses to accept the One who sent me.”
Week 63 | One Of You Will Turn Against Me

13:18

JN

Week 63 | Judas - The Literal And Symbolic Yeast - Is Leaving
JN
13:21
After Jesus said this, he was very troubled. He said openly, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me.”
JN
13:22
The followers all looked at each other, because they did not know whom Jesus was talking about.
JN
13:23
One of the followers sitting(ak) next to Jesus was the follower Jesus loved.
JN
13:24
Simon Peter motioned to him to ask Jesus whom he was talking about.
JN
13:25
That follower leaned closer to Jesus and asked, “Lord, who is it?”
JN
13:26
Jesus answered, “I will dip this bread into the dish. The man I give it to is the man who will turn against me.” So Jesus took a piece of bread, dipped it, and gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
JN
13:27
As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered him. Jesus said to him, “The thing that you will do-do it quickly.”
JN
13:28
No one at the table understood why Jesus said this to Judas.
JN
13:29
Since he was the one who kept the money box, some of the followers thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the feast or to give something to the poor.
JN
13:30
Judas took the bread Jesus gave him and immediately went out. It was night.

JN

JN

JN

All people will know that you are my followers if you love each other.”

Week 63 | You Will All Stumble In Your Faith
MT

LK

MK
14:31
But Peter insisted, “I will never say that I don’t know you! I will even die with you!” And all the other followers said the same thing.
Week 63 | Now Carry Money And Sword With You
LK

LK
22:36

LK
22:37
The Scripture says, ‘He was treated like a criminal,’(c) and I tell you this scripture must have its full meaning. It was written about me, and it is happening now.”
LK
22:38
His followers said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”
Week 63 | Ask Me For Anything In My Name
JN
14:1
Jesus said, “Don’t let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God, and trust in me.
JN

There are many rooms in my Father’s house; I would not tell you this if it were not true. I am going there to prepare a place for you.
JN

JN

You know the way to the place where I am going.”(am)

Thomas said to Jesus, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. So how can we know the way?”
JN

JN
14:7

JN

Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father. That is all we need.”
JN
14:9

JN
14:10
Don’t you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words I say to you don’t come from me, but the Father lives in me and does his own work.
JN
14:11
Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me. Or believe because of the miracles I have done.
JN

JN
14:13
And if you ask for anything in my name, I will do it for you so that the Father’s glory will be shown through the Son.
JN
14:14
If you ask me for anything in my name, I will do it.

Week 63 | Jesus Is Like A Vine
JN
15:1
“I am the true vine; my Father is the gardener.
JN
15:2
He cuts off every branch of mine that does not produce fruit. And he trims and cleans every branch that produces fruit so that it will produce even more fruit.
JN
15:3
You are already clean because of the words I have spoken to you.
JN
15:4
Remain in me, and I will remain in you. A branch cannot produce fruit alone but must remain in the vine. In the same way, you cannot produce fruit alone but must remain in me.
JN
15:5
“I am the vine, and you are the branches. If any remain in me and I remain in them, they produce much fruit. But without me they can do nothing.
JN
15:6
If any do not remain in me, they are like a branch that is thrown away and then dies. People pick up dead branches, throw them into the fire, and burn them.
JN
15:7
If you remain in me and follow my teachings, you can ask anything you want, and it will be given to you.
JN
15:8
You should produce much fruit and show that you are my followers, which brings glory to my Father.
JN
15:9
I loved you as the Father loved me. Now remain in my love.
JN
15:10
I have obeyed my Father’s commands, and I remain in his love. In the same way, if you obey my commands, you will remain in my love.
JN
15:11
I have told you these things so that you can have the same joy I have and so that your joy will be the fullest possible joy.
JN
15:12
“This is my command: Love each other as I have loved you.
JN
15:13
The greatest love a person can show is to die for his friends.
JN
15:14
You are my friends if you do what I command you.
JN
15:15
I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know what his master is doing. But I call you friends, because I have made known to you everything I heard from my Father.
JN
15:16
You did not choose me; I chose you. And I gave you this work: to go and produce fruit, fruit that will last. Then the Father will give you anything you ask for in my name.
JN
15:17
This is my command: Love each other.
Week 63 | The Followers And The World
JN
15:18
“If the world hates you, remember that it hated me first.
JN

JN
15:20
Remember what I told you: A servant is not greater than his master. If people did wrong to me, they will do wrong to you, too. And if they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours, too.
JN
15:21
They will do all this to you on account of me, because they do not know the One who sent me.
JN
15:22
If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.
JN
15:23
Whoever hates me also hates my Father.
JN
15:24

JN
15:25
But this happened so that what is written in their law would be true: ‘They hated me for no reason.’(ao)

Week 63 | The Work Of The Holy Spirit
JN
16:5
Now I am going back to the One who sent me. But none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

Your hearts are filled with sadness because I have told you these things.

JN

JN

JN

JN

JN

“I have many more things to say to you, but they are too much for you now.

JN

The Spirit of truth will bring glory to me, because he will take what I have to say and tell it to you.
JN
16:15
All that the Father has is mine. That is why I said that the Spirit will take what I have to say and tell it to you.
Week 63 | Sadness Will Become Happiness
JN
16:16
“After a little while you will not see me, and then after a little while you will see me again.”
JN
16:17
Some of the followers said to each other, “What does Jesus mean when he says, ‘After a little while you will not see me, and then after a little while you will see me again’? And what does he mean when he says, ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”
JN
16:18
They also asked, “What does he mean by ‘a little while’? We don’t understand what he is saying.”
JN
16:19
Jesus saw that the followers wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, “Are you asking each other what I meant when I said, ‘After a little while you will not see me, and then after a little while you will see me again’?
JN
16:20
I tell you the truth, you will cry and be sad, but the world will be happy. You will be sad, but your sadness will become joy.
JN
16:21
When a woman gives birth to a baby, she has pain, because her time has come. But when her baby is born, she forgets the pain, because she is so happy that a child has been born into the world.
JN
16:22
It is the same with you. Now you are sad, but I will see you again and you will be happy, and no one will take away your joy.
JN
16:23
In that day you will not ask me for anything. I tell you the truth, my Father will give you anything you ask for in my name.
JN
16:24
Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy will be the fullest possible joy.
Week 63 | Be Brave: I Have Defeated The World
JN
16:25
“I have told you these things indirectly in stories. But the time will come when I will not use stories like that to tell you things; I will speak to you in plain words about the Father.
JN
16:26
In that day you will ask the Father for things in my name. I mean, I will not need to ask the Father for you.
JN
16:27
The Father himself loves you. He loves you because you loved me and believed that I came from God.
JN
16:28
I came from the Father into the world. Now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”
JN
16:29
Then the followers of Jesus said, “You are speaking clearly to us now and are not using stories that are hard to understand.
JN
16:30

JN
16:31
Jesus answered, “So now you believe?
JN

JN
16:33

Week 63 | Jesus Prays For His Followers
JN
17:1
After Jesus said these things, he looked toward heaven and prayed, “Father, the time has come. Give glory to your Son so that the Son can give glory to you.
JN

You gave the Son power over all people so that the Son could give eternal life to all those you gave him.
JN
17:3
And this is eternal life: that people know you, the only true God, and that they know Jesus Christ, the One you sent.
JN
17:4
Having finished the work you gave me to do, I brought you glory on earth.
JN
17:5
And now, Father, give me glory with you; give me the glory I had with you before the world was made.
JN
17:6

JN
17:7
Now they know that everything you gave me comes from you.
JN
17:8
I gave them the teachings you gave me, and they accepted them. They knew that I truly came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
JN
17:9
I am praying for them. I am not praying for people in the world but for those you gave me, because they are yours.
JN
17:10
All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And my glory is shown through them.
JN
17:11
I am coming to you; I will not stay in the world any longer. But they are still in the world. Holy Father, keep them safe by the power of your name, the name you gave me, so that they will be one, just as you and I are one.
JN
17:12
While I was with them, I kept them safe by the power of your name, the name you gave me. I protected them, and only one of them, the one worthy of destruction, was lost so that the Scripture would come true.
JN
17:13
“I am coming to you now. But I pray these things while I am still in the world so that these followers can have all of my joy in them.
JN
17:14
I have given them your teaching. And the world has hated them, because they don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world.
JN
17:15
I am not asking you to take them out of the world but to keep them safe from the Evil One.
JN
17:16
They don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world.
JN
17:17
Make them ready for your service through your truth; your teaching is truth.
JN
17:18
I have sent them into the world, just as you sent me into the world.
JN
17:19
For their sake, I am making myself ready to serve so that they can be ready for their service of the truth.
JN
17:20
“I pray for these followers, but I am also praying for all those who will believe in me because of their teaching.
JN
17:21
Father, I pray that they can be one. As you are in me and I am in you, I pray that they can also be one in us. Then the world will believe that you sent me.
JN
17:22
I have given these people the glory that you gave me so that they can be one, just as you and I are one.
JN
17:23
I will be in them and you will be in me so that they will be completely one. Then the world will know that you sent me and that you loved them just as much as you loved me.
JN
17:24
“Father, I want these people that you gave me to be with me where I am. I want them to see my glory, which you gave me because you loved me before the world was made.
JN
17:25
Father, you are the One who is good. The world does not know you, but I know you, and these people know you sent me.
JN
17:26
I showed them what you are like, and I will show them again. Then they will have the same love that you have for me, and I will live in them.”
Week 63 | Jesus Is Arrested And Executed On The Day Of Passover Eve

MT

MT

MT
26:39

MT

MT

MT
26:42

MT
26:43

MT
26:44

MT
26:46

Then the soldiers with their commander and the guards arrested Jesus. They tied him
Week 63 | Hearing Before Annas
JN
18:13
and led him first to Annas, the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
JN
18:14
Caiaphas was the one who told the Jews that it would be better if one man died for all the people.
JN
18:15
Simon Peter and another one of Jesus’ followers went along after Jesus. This follower knew the high priest, so he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.
JN

JN
18:17
The girl at the door said to Peter, “Aren’t you also one of that man’s followers?” Peter answered, “No, I am not!”
JN
18:18
It was cold, so the servants and guards had built a fire and were standing around it, warming themselves. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.
JN
18:19
The high priest asked Jesus questions about his followers and his teaching.
JN

JN

So why do you question me? Ask the people who heard my teaching. They know what I said.”

JN
18:23

JN

Week 63 | Jesus is Led To Caiaphas
MK
14:53

MK
14:54

Week 63 | Trial Before The Leaders At Caiaphas
MT
26:59
The leading priests and the whole Jewish council tried to find something false against Jesus so they could kill him.
MT
26:60
Many people came and told lies about him, but the council could find no real reason to kill him. Then two people came and said,
MT
26:61
“This man said, ‘I can destroy the Temple of God and build it again in three days.’”
MT
26:62
Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Aren’t you going to answer? Don’t you have something to say about their charges against you?”
MT
26:63
But Jesus said nothing. Again the high priest said to Jesus, “I command you by the power of the living God: Tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
MT
26:64
Jesus answered, “Those are your words. But I tell you, in the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of God, the Powerful One, and coming on clouds in the sky.”
MT
26:65
When the high priest heard this, he tore his clothes and said, “This man has said things that are against God! We don’t need any more witnesses; you all heard him say these things against God.
MT
26:66
What do you think?” The people answered, “He should die.”
MT
26:67
Then the people there spat in Jesus’ face and beat him with their fists. Others slapped him.
LK
22:64
They blindfolded him and said, “Prove that you are a prophet, and tell us who hit you.”
Week 63 | Peter Says He Doesn’t Know Jesus
MT
26:69
At that time, as Peter was sitting in the courtyard, a servant girl came to him and said, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”
MT
26:70
But Peter said to all the people there that he was never with Jesus. He said, “I don’t know what you are talking about.”
MT
26:71
When he left the courtyard and was at the gate, another girl saw him. She said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
MT
26:72
Again, Peter said he was never with him, saying, “I swear I don’t know this man Jesus!”
MT
26:73
A short time later, some people standing there went to Peter and said, “Surely you are one of those who followed Jesus. The way you talk shows it.”
MT
26:74
Then Peter began to place a curse on himself and swear, “I don’t know the man.” At once, a rooster crowed.
MT
26:75
And Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: “Before the rooster crows, you will say three times that you don’t know me.” Then Peter went outside and cried painfully.
Week 63 | Judas' Confession And Suicide
MT
27:3
Judas, the one who had given Jesus to his enemies, saw that they had decided to kill Jesus. Then he was very sorry for what he had done. So he took the thirty silver coins back to the priests and the leaders,
MT
27:4
saying, “I sinned; I handed over to you an innocent man.” The leaders answered, “What is that to us? That’s your problem, not ours.”
MT
27:5
So Judas threw the money into the Temple. Then he went off and hanged himself.
MT
27:6
The leading priests picked up the silver coins in the Temple and said, “Our law does not allow us to keep this money with the Temple money, because it has paid for a man’s death.”
MT
27:7
So they decided to use the coins to buy Potter’s Field as a place to bury strangers who died in Jerusalem.
MT
27:8
That is why that field is still called the Field of Blood.
MT
27:9
So what Jeremiah the prophet had said came true: “They took thirty silver coins. That is how little the Israelites thought he was worth.
MT
27:10
They used those thirty silver coins to buy the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”(co)
Week 63 | Jesus Is Turned Over To Pilates
JN
18:28
Early in the morning they led Jesus from Caiaphas’s house to the Roman governor’s palace. They would not go inside the palace, because they did not want to make themselves unclean;(as) they wanted to eat the Passover meal.
Week 63 | Pilate Questions Jesus
JN
18:29
So Pilate went outside to them and asked, “What charges do you bring against this man?”
JN
18:30
They answered, “If he were not a criminal, we wouldn’t have brought him to you.”
MT
27:12
When the leading priests and the elders accused Jesus, he said nothing.
MT
27:13
So Pilate said to Jesus, “Don’t you hear them accusing you of all these things?”
MK
15:3
The leading priests accused Jesus of many things.
MK
15:4
So Pilate asked Jesus another question, “You can see that they are accusing you of many things. Aren’t you going to answer?”
MK
15:5
But Jesus still said nothing, so Pilate was very surprised.
JN
18:31
Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law.” “But we are not allowed to put anyone to death,” the Jews answered.
JN
18:32
(This happened so that what Jesus said about how he would die would come true.)
JN
18:33
Then Pilate went back inside the palace and called Jesus to him and asked, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
JN
18:34
Jesus said, “Is that your own question, or did others tell you about me?”
JN
18:35
Pilate answered, “I am not one of you. It was your own people and their leading priests who handed you over to me. What have you done wrong?”
JN
18:36
Jesus answered, “My kingdom does not belong to this world. If it belonged to this world, my servants would have fought to keep me from being given over to the Jewish leaders. But my kingdom is from another place.”
JN
18:37
Pilate said, “So you are a king!” Jesus answered, “You are the one saying I am a king. This is why I was born and came into the world: to tell people the truth. And everyone who belongs to the truth listens to me.”
JN
18:38
Pilate said, “What is truth?” After he said this, he went out to the crowd again and said to them, “I find nothing against this man.
LK
23:5
They were insisting, saying, “But Jesus makes trouble with the people, teaching all around Judea. He began in Galilee, and now he is here.”
Week 63 | Pilate Sends Jesus to Herod
LK
23:6
Pilate heard this and asked if Jesus was from Galilee.
LK
23:7
Since Jesus was under Herod’s authority, Pilate sent Jesus to Herod, who was in Jerusalem at that time.
LK
23:8
When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, because he had heard about Jesus and had wanted to meet him for a long time. He was hoping to see Jesus work a miracle.
LK
23:9
Herod asked Jesus many questions, but Jesus said nothing.
LK
23:10
The leading priests and teachers of the law were standing there, strongly accusing Jesus.
LK

After Herod and his soldiers had made fun of Jesus, they dressed him in a kingly robe and sent him back to Pilate.
LK
23:12
In the past, Pilate and Herod had always been enemies, but on that day they became friends.
Week 63 | Pilate Declares: Jesus Is Not Guilty
LK

Pilate called the people together with the leading priests and the rulers.
LK

LK
23:15
Also, Herod found nothing wrong with him; he sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing for which he should die.
LK
23:16
So, after I punish him, I will let him go free.”
Week 63 | Jesus Or Barabbas
MK

MK

When the people gathered at Pilate’s house, Pilate said, “Whom do you want me to set free: Barabbas(c) or Jesus who is called the Christ?”
MT

Pilate knew that they turned Jesus in to him because they were jealous.
MT

Week 63 | Pilate Argues For Jesus Against The People
JN

JN

JN
19:15

Week 63 | The Crucifixion
LK
23:33

MK
15:25

JN

JN
19:20
The sign was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek. Many of the people read the sign, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city.
JN
19:21
The leading priests said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews.’ But write, ‘This man said, “I am the King of the Jews.”’”
JN

Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
LK
23:34

JN
19:23
After the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, with each soldier getting one part. They also took his long shirt, which was all one piece of cloth, woven from top to bottom.
JN
19:24
So the soldiers said to each other, “We should not tear this into parts. Let’s throw lots to see who will get it.” This happened so that this Scripture would come true: “They divided my clothes among them, and they threw lots for my clothing.” (Psalm 22:18) So the soldiers did this.
JN
19:25
Standing near his cross were Jesus’ mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
JN

JN
19:27
Then he said to the follower, “Here is your mother.” From that time on, the follower took her to live in his home.

MT

JN

JN
19:35
(The one who saw this happen is the one who told us this, and whatever he says is true. And he knows that he tells the truth, and he tells it so that you might believe.)

Week 63-70+ | God Rises Jesus Back To Life

MT
27:64

LK

but they were kept from recognizing him.

LK
24:19
Jesus said to them, “What are you talking about?” They said, “About Jesus of Nazareth. He was a prophet who said and did many powerful things before God and all the people.
LK
24:20
Our leaders and the leading priests handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him.
LK

But we were hoping that he would free Israel. Besides this, it is now the third day since this happened.
LK
24:22
And today some women among us amazed us. Early this morning they went to the tomb,
LK
24:23
but they did not find his body there. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels who said that Jesus was alive!
LK
24:24
So some of our group went to the tomb, too. They found it just as the women said, but they did not see Jesus.”
LK
24:25
Then Jesus said to them, “You are foolish and slow to believe everything the prophets said.
LK
24:26
They said that the Christ must suffer these things before he enters his glory.”
LK
24:27
Then starting with what Moses and all the prophets had said about him, Jesus began to explain everything that had been written about himself in the Scriptures.
LK
24:28
They came near the town of Emmaus, and Jesus acted as if he were going farther.
LK
24:29
But they begged him, “Stay with us, because it is late; it is almost night.” So he went in to stay with them.
LK
24:30
When Jesus was at the table with them, he took some bread, gave thanks, divided it, and gave it to them.
LK
24:31
And then, they were allowed to recognize Jesus. But when they saw who he was, he disappeared.
LK
24:32

LK
24:33
So the two followers got up at once and went back to Jerusalem. There they found the eleven apostles and others gathered.
LK
24:34
They were saying, “The Lord really has risen from the dead! He showed himself to Simon.”
LK
24:35
Then the two followers told what had happened on the road and how they recognized Jesus when he divided the bread.
Week 63 | Jesus Appears In The Last Supper's Room
LK
24:36
While the two followers were telling this, Jesus himself stood right in the middle of them and said, “Peace be with you.”
LK
24:37
They were fearful and terrified and thought they were seeing a ghost.
LK
24:38
But Jesus said, “Why are you troubled? Why do you doubt what you see?
LK
24:39
Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see, because a ghost does not have a living body as you see I have.”
LK
24:40
After Jesus said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
LK
24:41
While they still could not believe it because they were amazed and happy, Jesus said to them, “Do you have any food here?”
LK
24:42
They gave him a piece of broiled fish.
LK
24:43
While the followers watched, Jesus took the fish and ate it.
LK
24:44
He said to them, “Remember when I was with you before? I said that everything written about me must happen-everything in the law of Moses, the books of the prophets, and the Psalms.”
LK
24:45
Then Jesus opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.
LK
24:46
He said to them, “It is written that the Christ would suffer and rise from the dead on the third day
LK
24:47
and that a change of hearts and lives and forgiveness of sins would be preached in his name to all nations, starting at Jerusalem.
LK
24:48
You are witnesses of these things.
LK
24:49
I will send you what my Father has promised, but you must stay in Jerusalem until you have received that power from heaven.”
Week 64 | Jesus Appears Again In The Presence Of Thomas
JN
20:24
Thomas (called Didymus), who was one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
JN
20:25
The other followers kept telling Thomas, “We saw the Lord.” But Thomas said, “I will not believe it until I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were and put my hand into his side.”
JN
20:26
A week later the followers were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. The doors were locked, but Jesus came in and stood right in the middle of them. He said, “Peace be with you.”
JN
20:27
Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Put your hand here in my side. Stop being an unbeliever and believe.”
JN
20:28
Thomas said to him, “My Lord and my God!”
JN
20:29
Then Jesus told him, “You believe because you see me. Those who believe without seeing me will be truly blessed.”
Week 64-70 | The Ascension
Act
25:6
When the apostles were all together, they asked Jesus, “Lord, are you now going to give the kingdom back to Israel?”
Act
25:7
Jesus said to them, “The Father is the only One who has the authority to decide dates and times. These things are not for you to know.
Act
25:8
But when the Holy Spirit comes to you, you will receive power. You will be my witnesses-in Jerusalem, in all of Judea, in Samaria, and in every part of the world.”
Act
25:9
After he said this, as they were watching, he was lifted up, and a cloud hid him from their sight.
Act
25:10
As he was going, they were looking into the sky. Suddenly, two men wearing white clothes stood beside them.
Act
25:11
They said, “Men of Galilee, why are you standing here looking into the sky? Jesus, whom you saw taken up from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you saw him go.”
Week 64-70 | The Followers Wait For The Holy Spirit By Praying Together
Act
25:12
Then they went back to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives. (This mountain is about half a mile from Jerusalem.)
Act
25:13
When they entered the city, they went to the upstairs room where they were staying. Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James son of Alphaeus, Simon (known as the Zealot), and Judas son of James were there.
Act
25:14
They all continued praying together with some women, including Mary the mother of Jesus, and Jesus’ brothers.
Week 70 | The Holy Spirit Baptise The Followers
Act
26:1
When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.
Act
26:2
Suddenly a noise like a strong, blowing wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.
Act
26:3
They saw something like flames of fire that were separated and stood over each person there.
Act
26:4
They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they began to speak different languages(a) by the power the Holy Spirit was giving them.
Jesus Encourages Peter
JN
21:1
Later, Jesus showed himself to his followers again-this time at Lake Galilee.(ba) This is how he showed himself:
JN
21:2
Some of the followers were together: Simon Peter, Thomas (called Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the two sons of Zebedee, and two other followers.
JN
21:3
Simon Peter said, “I am going out to fish.” The others said, “We will go with you.” So they went out and got into the boat. They fished that night but caught nothing.
JN
21:4
Early the next morning Jesus stood on the shore, but the followers did not know it was Jesus.
JN
21:5
Then he said to them, “Friends, did you catch any fish?” They answered, “No.”
JN
21:6
He said, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they did, and they caught so many fish they could not pull the net back into the boat.
JN
21:7
The follower whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Peter heard him say this, he wrapped his coat around himself. (Peter had taken his clothes off.) Then he jumped into the water.
JN
21:8
The other followers went to shore in the boat, dragging the net full of fish. They were not very far from shore, only about a hundred yards.
JN
21:9
When the followers stepped out of the boat and onto the shore, they saw a fire of hot coals. There were fish on the fire, and there was bread.
JN
21:10
Then Jesus said, “Bring some of the fish you just caught.”
JN
21:11
Simon Peter went into the boat and pulled the net to the shore. It was full of big fish, one hundred fifty-three in all, but even though there were so many, the net did not tear.
JN
21:12
Jesus said to them, “Come and eat.” None of the followers dared ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord.
JN
21:13
Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, along with the fish.
JN
21:14
This was now the third time Jesus showed himself to his followers after he was raised from the dead.
Jesus Triple Checks If Peter Regained His Faith
JN
21:15
When they finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?” He answered, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Feed my lambs.”
JN
21:16
Again Jesus said, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” He answered, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Take care of my sheep.”
JN
21:17
A third time he said, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” Peter said, “Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you!” He said to him, “Feed my sheep.
JN
21:18
I tell you the truth, when you were younger, you tied your own belt and went where you wanted. But when you are old, you will put out your hands and someone else will tie you and take you where you don’t want to go.”
JN
21:19
(Jesus said this to show how Peter would die to give glory to God.) Then Jesus said to Peter, “Follow me!”
JN
21:20
Peter turned and saw that the follower Jesus loved was walking behind them. (This was the follower who had leaned against Jesus at the supper and had said, “Lord, who will turn against you?”)
JN
21:21
When Peter saw him behind them, he asked Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
JN
21:22
Jesus answered, “If I want him to live until I come back, that is not your business. You follow me.”
JN
21:23
So a story spread among the followers that this one would not die. But Jesus did not say he would not die. He only said, “If I want him to live until I come back, that is not your business.”
JN
21:24
That follower is the one who is telling these things and who has now written them down. We know that what he says is true.
Jesus Sends Out The Apostles To Everyone In The World
MT
28:16
The eleven followers went to Galilee to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
MT
28:17
On the mountain they saw Jesus and worshiped him, but some of them did not believe it was really Jesus.
MT
28:18
Then Jesus came to them and said, “All power in heaven and on earth is given to me.
MT
28:19
So go and make followers of all people in the world. Baptize them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
MK
16:16
Anyone who believes and is baptized will be saved, but anyone who does not believe will be punished.
MK
16:17
And those who believe will be able to do these things as proof: They will use my name to force out demons. They will speak in new languages.(bi)
MK
16:18
They will pick up snakes and drink poison without being hurt. They will touch the sick, and the sick will be healed.”
MT
28:20
Teach them to obey everything that I have taught you, and I will be with you always, even until the end of this age.”
The Apostles Tell The Good News To Eeveryone In The World
MK
16:20
The followers went everywhere in the world and told the Good News to people, and the Lord helped them. The Lord proved that the Good News they told was true by giving them power to work miracles.
